go_data.justification: ERF1a is a member of the AP2/ERF superfamily of transcription factors, which bind DNA at an AGCCGCC motif (GCC-box) in promoter regions of the target genes.
As a transcription factor, ERF1a localizes to the nucleus to regulate the expression of target genes.
ERF1a, as a transcription factor, is involved in regulating the expression of target genes by binding to their promoter regions.
